DataElement.preferredName: Disease Present Person Biopsy Ability Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response for questions to determine clinical trial eligibility that address the present of dieases and the ability of a person to have a biopsy as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Present Person Biopsy Ability Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time._A human being._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: Present Person Biopsy Ability Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.:A human being.:The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.:The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is biopsiable disease present
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is biopsiable disease present and patient is able to undergo pre-treatment and on-treatment biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a biopsiable target lesion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled on Trial 1 (copanlisib + nivolumab), does patient have biopsiable disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: For the Dose-expansion phase: Does patient have a biopsiable lesion and patient is able to provide consent for on treatment biopsy?
